intro: Venidium angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved venidium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, alternate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Venidium angustifolium typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
